sect2.title: Introduction to GLib
sect2.para: The glib package contains a low-level core library. This is useful for providing data structure handling for C, portability wrappers and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an event loop, threads, dynamic loading, and an object system.

sect2.title: Installation of GLib
sect2.para: Install glib by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --enable-gtk-doc: This switch will rebuild the API documentation during the make command.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The glib package contains glib-genmarshal, glib-gettextize, glib-mkenums, gobject-query, libglib-2.0, libgobject-2.0, libgmodule-2.0 and libgthread-2.0 libraries.

sect3.title: glib-genmarshal
sect3.para: glib-genmarshal is a C code marshaller generation utility for GLib closures.

sect3.title: glib-gettextize
sect3.para: glib-gettextize is a variant of the gettext internationalization utility.

sect3.title: glib-mkenums
sect3.para: glib-mkenums is a C language enum description generation utility.

sect3.title: gobject-query
sect3.para: gobject-query is a small utility that draws a tree of types.

sect3.title: GLib libraries
sect3.para: GLib libraries contain a low-level core library for the GIMP Toolkit.
